dataset.title: Yale-Post Long-Term Study Lakes, CT: nutrients, 2005-2010

abstract.para: Long term data for 6 lakes: Bridge, Dodge, Rogers, Pattagansett, Quonnipaug, and Hayward. Data for 13 other lakes included with the long term data. This was collected for a study which is outlined in Post et al. 2008. Data collection is currently ongoing, but only for the 6 long term study lakes.

intellectualRights.para: Data belong to Dr. David Post

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Inland lakes with long-term observations, CT, USA

section.title: TP water sample
section.para: Composite epi samples. Water is pooled from the top three sample depths (as indicated in the [Chl] actual data table—“Sample” column, where the top three depths are “Depth 1”- “Depth 3”).

section.title: TN water samples
section.para: Composite epi samples. Water is pooled from the top three sample depths (as indicated in the [Chl] actual data table—“Sample” column, where the top three depths are “Depth 1”- “Depth 3”).

section.title: TP lab analysis
section.para: Persulfate digestion and colorimetric analysis on Astoria 2 autoanalyzer (Astoria-Pacific International, Clackamas, Oregon, USA).
Standard curves are used for calibration. Duplicates are run, and samples are rerun when the duplicates vary by more than 10%.

section.title: TN lab analysis
section.para: Persulfate digestion on an Astoria-Pacific International autoanalyzer.
Standard curves are used for calibration. Duplicates are run, and samples are rerun when the duplicates vary by more than 10%.

description.para: Inland lakes in CT. The six long term study lakes. And 13 lakes that were sampled only during the summer of 2004 or summer of 2005

samplingDescription.para: ampling occurred every 2-3 weeks from May- December (during ice-off periods). Note that sampling is not necessarily consistent and samples may not have been collected every 2-3 weeks for all lakes.

dataTable.entityDescription: Yale-Post Long-Term Study Lakes, CT: nutrients, 2005-2010

codeDefinition.definition: When a duplicate sample had greater than 10% relative mean difference, the lower value of TN or TP was selected.
